definition: to take a tonic (for one's health)
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.english: Three kinds of children is certain to consider suitable cures in winter.
sentences.chinese: 有三类孩子的确需要考虑在冬天适当进补。

sentences.english: Therefore, the elderly should not be arbitrarily tonic.
sentences.chinese: 因此，老年人不宜随意进补。

sentences.english: Taking nourishing food in winter to build up health has been used as the usual health care method since ancient time.
sentences.chinese: 冬季进补是我国人民自古以来常用的自身保健方法。

sentences.english: The young do not need special tonic.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人则不需要特别进补。

sentences.english: Chinese wolfberry as medicine and food is tasted, the supplements have multiple edible method.
sentences.chinese: 枸杞作为药食两用的进补佳品，有多种食用方法。

sentences.english: Therefore, people always put the chicken as the top grade disease after repair.
sentences.chinese: 故此，人们一直把鸡作为病后进补的上品。

sentences.english: However, before taking tonic, children should take "plough medicine", and have cured the illness.
sentences.chinese: 但是在进补之前必须先服“开路药”，并且治好疾病。

sentences.english: With proper clothing against cold, turnip mungbean good signings.
sentences.chinese: 适当加衣防感冒，萝卜绿豆好进补。

definition: tonic food (food considered to be particularly healthful)/to eat such foods
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
the benefits of medicine are not as great as those of good nutrition
pinyin: yao4 bu3 bu4 ru2 shi2 bu3

definition: a person who is in poor health cannot handle sth so strong as a tonic
medicinal dietary supplement that helps build up one's health
